@example.01-basic.sugar.style.resets.Glo.name: Global reset
@example.01-basic.sugar.style.resets.Glo.description:
These mixins allows you to apply some resets like `destyle` and/or the `sugar` one.
The `destyle` one is well known and you can find the documentation on their website.
The `sugar` one is our own that add some resets like setting max-width to 100% for images, and some more. Check our his own documentation page.

@example.01-basic.sugar.style.resets.Des.name: Destyle reset
@example.01-basic.sugar.style.resets.Des.description: These mixins allows you to apply the `destyle` reset easily.

@example.01-basic.sugar.style.resets.Sug.name: Sugar reset
@example.01-basic.sugar.style.resets.Sug.description: This mixin allows you to apply the `sugar` reset easily.

@example.01-basic.sugar.style.font.title.description: This declare the @font-face for the "<yellow>title</yellow> font family"

@example.01-basic.sugar.style.ui.Toggles.name: Toggles
@example.01-basic.sugar.style.ui.Toggles.description:
These classes allows you to display any HTMLElement as a toggle.
Toggles are element that have at least 2 states. Active and unactive.
This active state respect these rules:

- &:active
- &:focus
- &:focus-within
- input:checked + &
- input:checked + .s-menu + &
- :active > &
- :focus > &
- :focus-within > &
- &:has(input:checked)
- input:checked +
> &
- input:checked + .s-menu +
> &

example.title: Toggles
example.code: burger

@example.01-basic.sugar.style.ui.Typogra.name: Typography
@example.01-basic.sugar.style.ui.Typogra.description:
These classes allows you to apply basic typo styles like `sub`, `strong`, etc... on any HTMLElement
These styles are defined in the `theme.typo` theme settings.

example.title: h1
example.code: Woodrow Gottlieb

example.title: h2
example.code: Monique Kuvalis

example.title: h3
example.code: Opal Monahan

example.title: h4

example.title: h5

example.title: h6
example.code: Jonathan Purdy

example.title: p

example.title: lead
example.code:
<lead class="s-typo:lead">
      Sharon Crist
  </lead>

example.title: hr
example.code:
<hr class="s-typo:hr">
      Saul Ratke
  </hr>

example.title: pre:not([class])

      Miss Linda Erdman

example.title: code:not(pre > code)

      Miss Meredith Shields

@example.01-basic.sugar.style.helpers.Fi.name: Fit Sizes
@example.01-basic.sugar.style.helpers.Fi.description:
These classes allows you to apply a fit size on any HTMLElement.
On image and video, uses `object-fit` property, on all others,
simply fill the element using an absolute position, top: 0, left: 0 and width/height: 100%.

@example.01-basic.sugar.style.helpers.Of.name: Offsize
@example.01-basic.sugar.style.helpers.Of.description:
These classes allows you to apply an offsize to any HTMLElement.
An offsize is a "space" that you want to ADD to the width/height of an element.
You can specify where you want to add this offsize like for margin and padding by using the "inline" and "block" notation.

example.title: All around
Inline
Block
Inline end

@example.01-basic.sugar.style.tools.Scal.name: Scale
@example.01-basic.sugar.style.tools.Scal.description:
These classes allows to apply a scale to any supported UI elements.
This scale does not use the transform property but increase actual values like `padding`,
`margin`, etc... In fact, all the properties setted with the `sugar.scallable` function.
It's usually a good practice to set the `font-size` of your UI element to `sugar.scalable(1rem)`
and then to set inner values using `em` unit.

@example.01-basic.sugar.style.helpers.Sh.name: Shape
@example.01-basic.sugar.style.helpers.Sh.description:
These classes allows you to apply a shape to any elements that support it using the
`border-radius: sugar.border.radius(shape);` statement.

example.title: Shape on buttons
example.code: Default shape Square shape Pill shape

@example.01-basic.sugar.style.helpers.Wi.name: Widths
@example.01-basic.sugar.style.helpers.Wi.description:
These classes allows to apply some width to any HTMLElement.
These widths are defined in the `theme.width` theme settings.

example.code: s-width:0
s-width:10
s-width:20
s-width:30
s-width:40
s-width:50
s-width:60
s-width:70
s-width:80
s-width:90
s-width:100

@example.01-basic.sugar.style.ui.Icons.name: Icons
@example.01-basic.sugar.style.ui.Icons.description:
These classes represent all the icons that you have listed in your project using the @sugar.icon.classes mixin.
By using this mixin, your icons will be accessible using the same s-icon:{name} classes
independently of the icon source that can be *Fontawesome** or your **Filesystem**.
These providers are the one that we support for now but others can be added if needed.

example.title: Used icons in this website
example.code:
github

Source: fab


discord

Source: fab


twitter

Source: fab


facebook

Source: fab


patreon

Source: fab


instagram

Source: fab


drop-file

Source: sugar


help

Source: sugar


help

Source: sugar

global reset.name: Global reset
global reset.description:
These mixins allows you to apply some resets like `destyle` and/or the `sugar` one.
The `destyle` one is well known and you can find the documentation on their website.
The `sugar` one is our own that add some resets like setting max-width to 100% for images, and some more. Check our his own documentation page.

destyle reset.name: Destyle reset
destyle reset.description: These mixins allows you to apply the `destyle` reset easily.

sugar reset.name: Sugar reset
sugar reset.description: This mixin allows you to apply the `sugar` reset easily.

padding.name: Padding
padding.description: These classes allows you to apply padding to any HTMLElement
